page.title: 14POLICE AND CRIME.
page.content: In Southwold there are seven police-men and women working full time.The station is responsible for Reydon as well.It is open to the public between{10am}to{11am}and{6.30pm to{7.30pm}every day but has to be closed otherwise owing to the small number of work-force.Dogs are available,but none are kept on the premises. The main crimes in the area are: speeding,drunken driving,and robbery_ owing to its being a rich area.Those offending are tried on the{Beccles {Petty Sessional Division Bench}where fifteen magistrates sit. Punishments range from fines-for speeding-to imprisonment for robbery.Although there is relatively high unemploy- ment there is no trouble caused by the unemployed.Although Southwold is on the coast,there is no smuggling.
